title: Ministry issues draft guidelines on establishing EV charging infrastructure under PM E-DRIVE - BusinessLine
summary:
Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for EV Charging Infrastructure

Date & Source: Updated - December 30, 2024 at 01:34 PM, The Hindu Business Line

Introduction: The Ministry of Heavy Industries (MHI) has issued draft guidelines for setting up electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure under the Prime Minister Electric Drive Revolution in Innovative Vehicle Enhancement (PM E-DRIVE) Scheme.

  1. The scheme aims to set up over 22,000 EV chargers for electric four wheelers and 1,800 chargers for e-buses.
  2. It also includes provisions for charging infrastructure for light EVs like electric two-wheelers and electric three-wheelers.
  3. The government aims to involve various stakeholders, including charge point operators, EV charger manufacturers, and other government bodies.
  4. The scheme offers an 80% subsidy on upstream infrastructure, with an outlay of ₹2,000 crore.

Notable Quote: According to the draft guidelines, central-level Ministries and State governments are encouraged to carry out feasibility studies to identify suitable locations for EV charging stations.

Conclusion: The draft guidelines for EV charging infrastructure aim to expand public charging facilities, involving various stakeholders and offering significant subsidies to promote EV adoption in India.
newTitle: India's Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for Expanding EV Charging Infrastructure

title: Year-ender | Top space exploration moments and discoveries of 2024 - CNBCTV18
summary:
Top Space Exploration Moments and Discoveries of 2024

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: CNBC TV18

2024 saw significant advancements in space exploration, with notable achievements including Japan's successful moon landing, the first private spacecraft to land on the moon, the retrieval of lunar samples, evidence of ancient microbial life on Mars, the first all-civilian spacewalk, and a mission to Jupiter's icy moon Europa. These milestones push the boundaries of human and robotic space exploration and pave the way for future discoveries.

  • Japan becomes the fifth country to land on the moon.
  • Intuitive Machines' Odysseus spacecraft becomes the first private spacecraft to land on the moon.
  • China's Chang'e 6 mission retrieves lunar samples from the far side of the moon.
  • NASA's Perseverance rover finds evidence of ancient microbial life on Mars.
  • SpaceX conducts the first all-civilian spacewalk.
  • Boeing's Starliner spacecraft has issues with its thrusters, delaying the return of astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.
  • NASA's Europa Clipper begins its journey to Jupiter's icy moon Europa.
These achievements highlight the progress and innovation happening in space exploration and set the stage for even more fascinating discoveries in the coming years.

While these discoveries and milestones are exciting, they also raise important questions about the future of space exploration, such as how to ensure safe and sustainable exploration, the role of private companies in space, and how to protect our planet's unique environment.
newTitle: Top Space Exploration Moments and Discoveries of 2024

title: 9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025 - Times Now
summary:
9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Times Now

This article outlines nine superfoods that can aid in weight loss through their nutritional benefits and ability to help control appetite.

  • Avocados: High in monounsaturated fats and fiber, helping control hunger.
  • Oats: A source of soluble fiber that keeps you full and lowers cholesterol.
  • Chia Seeds: Packed with fiber and protein, promoting a feeling of fullness.
  • Green Tea: Contains catechins that enhance metabolism and aid weight loss.
  • Lentils: An excellent source of plant-based protein and fiber for stabilizing blood sugar.
  • Sweet Potatoes: Low in calories and high in fiber, providing a healthy carbohydrate option.
  • Greek Yogurt: High in protein and supports gut health.
  • Apples: High in water and fiber, naturally sweet, and help reduce calorie intake.
  • Spinach: Low in calories and rich in nutrients, great for anyone trying to lose weight.
“Losing weight isn’t just about cutting calories; it’s about nourishing your body with the right foods that enhance metabolism, curb cravings, and provide essential nutrients.”

In conclusion, incorporating these nine superfoods into your diet may significantly aid in weight loss and overall health.
newTitle: 9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025

title: Amid Row Over Schemes, Kejriwal Launches New 'Yojana' For Priests, To Give Rs 18,000 A Month - News18
summary:

Date & Source: Last Updated: December 30, 2024, 18:42 IST, News18

Introduction: Ahead of the upcoming Delhi Assembly polls, Arvind Kejriwal, the chief of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has announced the 'Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana', which promises a monthly honorarium of nearly Rs 18,000 to priests of temples and 'granthis' of the Gurudwara.

  • Kejriwal's announcement comes amidst a row surrounding the 'Mahila Samman Yojana', another welfare scheme by AAP.
  • The BJP has criticized the new scheme, calling it 'deception'.

... (Kejriwal's tweet on the scheme)

Conclusion: The implementation of this scheme, if AAP wins the elections, would mark a significant step towards recognizing and rewarding the contributions of priests and granthis in Delhi's religious and cultural landscape.

Rohit Sharma has decided to retire after the Sydney Test, prompting discussions on whether he should step down immediately due to his poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

title: Snowfall And Sub-Zero Temperatures In Kashmir: Doctors Warn Of Heart Attack And Stroke Risk! - Times Now
summary:
Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times Now

As temperatures in Kashmir plunge below freezing, health experts warn of heightened risks for heart attacks and strokes. The Department of Cardiology at GMC Srinagar has issued an advisory for residents, especially those at higher risk, to take precautions.

  • Heart-related emergencies, such as Myocardial Infarction (MI), are leading causes of death worldwide.
  • 30% of adults in Kashmir suffer from hypertension, significantly increasing risk factors.
  • Cold weather increases blood pressure and stresses the heart due to vasoconstriction.
“Increased consumption of salt... and reliance on processed foods contribute to elevated blood pressure,” - Dr Irfan Ahmed Bhat.

Preventative measures include staying warm, modifying outdoor activities, and regular health monitoring to manage risks effectively.
newTitle: Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space - Times Now
summary:
7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article features a stunning collection of the latest space pictures captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing various celestial phenomena.

  • The Mice NGC 4676: Colliding spiral galaxies indicating star formation.
  • Westerlund 2: A star cluster located in a stellar nursery.
  • Discovering Protostellar OH 339.88-1.26: A dusty area with bright stars.
  • Young Star HH-47: A complex stellar formation.
  • XZ Tauri: A multiple star system with gas expulsion.
  • Red Giant Star CW Leonis: A stunning carbon star image.
  • Ghostly Star Forming Pillar: The Cone Nebula captured in detail.
“NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured an impressive image of the multiple star system known as XZ Tauri alongside neighbor HL Tauri and several young stellar objects.”

This article provides a glimpse into the wonders of space explored by the Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting remarkable cosmic phenomena.
newTitle: 7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow - News18
summary:
'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow

Date: December 30, 2024
Source: News18

Tesla CEO Elon Musk has labeled the H-1B visa system as “broken” and called for “major reform” just days after expressing his willingness to defend the system, which allows skilled foreign workers to work in the US.

  • Musk stated that the current H-1B system needs significant reforms to better attract elite talent.
  • He suggested raising the minimum salary for H-1B visa applicants to make hiring foreign workers more expensive than hiring domestically.
  • The debate surrounding H-1B visas has intensified, particularly with political figures like Trump also voicing support for the program.
Easily fixed by raising the minimum salary significantly and adding a yearly cost for maintaining the H1B, making it materially more expensive to hire from overseas than domestically. I’ve been very clear that the program is broken and needs major reform. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 29, 2024

The impact of Musk’s comments reflects ongoing discussions about immigration and the role of foreign talent in the US economy.
newTitle: 'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow

title: Virat Kohli refuses to learn from his mistake, commentators got no chill: 'He has turned into a nicking machine' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Virat Kohli was once again out caught behind, leaving fans frustrated and commentators amused.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli's disappointing performance continues as he is caught behind once again during India's Boxing Day Test against Australia, leading to growing frustration among fans and commentators alike.

  • Kohli dismissed for just five runs off 29 balls.
  • This marks the fifth time in the series that Kohli has been caught behind.
  • Commentators, including James Brayshaw, labeled him a 'nicking machine' due to his repeated dismissals.
  • 2024 has been Kohli's worst year in Test cricket, ending with only 417 runs from 19 innings.
“GONE! He's out flashing outside off stump… out of nowhere. It's been pouched by Khawaja, and the third wicket falls. He has turned into a nicking machine,” said James Brayshaw.

Kohli's inconsistency has raised concerns about his future performance as a key player for India in Test cricket.
newTitle: Virat Kohli's Continued Struggles Leave Fans Frustrated

title: She sang it better at 91: Karan Aujla on Asha Bhosle's 'Tauba Tauba' performance - India Today
summary:
Singer Asha Bhosle, 91, Viral 'Tauba Tauba' Performance in Dubai

Date: Dec 30, 2024
Source: India Today

At her Dubai concert, veteran singer Asha Bhosle, 91, captivated the audience by singing Karan Aujla's chartbuster "Tauba Tauba" and even recreating the hook step originally performed by actor Vicky Kaushal. A video of her performance has gone viral on social media.

Draped elegantly in a white saree, Bhosle delivered a remarkable rendition of "Tauba Tauba" from the film Bad Newz. She set aside her microphone and performed the hook step, drawing loud cheers from the crowd.

The video sparked admiration and love from colleagues in the music and film industries. Karan Aujla, the original singer of "Tauba Tauba," expressed his gratitude with a heartfelt note and shared the video, stating, "She sang it at 91 better than me."

Watch the video here: https://www.indiatoday.in/videos

  1. Asha Bhosle's performance earned praise from numerous industry colleagues.
  2. The viral video highlights the singer's agility and adaptability at 91.
  3. The event brought together different generations and cultures through music.

Notable Quote: "She sang it at 91 better than me." - Karan Aujla

Conclusion: Asha Bhosle's 'Tauba Tauba' performance at 91 serves as an inspiration, proving that age is just a number when it comes to passion and talent.
newTitle: Asha Bhosle's Viral 'Tauba Tauba' Performance at 91 Leaves Fans in Awestruck

title: 7 reasons to eat radish superfood in winter - Health shots
summary:
7 Health Benefits Of Radish In Winter

Published Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Healthshots

Looking for a winter superfood? Add radish to your diet. This crunchy and delicious vegetable is packed with several essential nutrients and offers numerous health benefits.

  • Packed With Nutrients: Radishes are low in calories but high in essential nutrients like vitamin C, potassium, folate, and fibre.
  • Hydrates Your Body: Comprising about 95% water, radishes keep the body hydrated and support kidney function.
  • Promotes Digestion: High in fibre, radishes help regulate bowel movements and promote healthy digestion.
  • Supports Weight Loss: Low in calories and high in fibre and water content, radishes make you feel full longer.
  • Lowers High Blood Pressure: Rich in potassium, radishes help maintain healthy fluid balance and regulate blood pressure.
  • Boosts Immunity: High vitamin C content strengthens the immune system, aiding in fighting off infections.
  • Good for Skin: Antioxidants and vitamin C in radishes help fight free radicals, reducing wrinkles and keeping skin youthful.
“Regular consumption of radishes may help reduce wrinkles and keep your skin looking youthful.”

Incorporating radish into your winter diet can provide a variety of health benefits, making it a great addition to meals.
newTitle: 7 Health Benefits of Eating Radish in Winter

South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Pilot in Jeju Air plane crash mentioned bird strike, says Transport ministry official - The Indian Express
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

The pilot of the Jeju Air flight that crashed at Muan International Airport reported a bird strike shortly before declaring mayday and crashing, resulting in a national mourning period as investigations continue.

  • The crash claimed the lives of 179 passengers, leaving only two crew members.
  • The flight was arriving from Bangkok with 181 passengers and six crew members on board.
  • An emergency meeting was held, and a special disaster zone was declared at the crash site.
  • The incident occurred shortly after 9 am local time as the aircraft veered off the runway and hit a wall.
  • South Korean acting President Choi Sang-mok emphasized the government's commitment to recovery and prevention of future incidents.
“The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence.” - Choi Sang-mok

This tragic incident highlights the critical need for safety measures in aviation following similar past occurrences.
newTitle: Pilot Reports Bird Strike in Jeju Air Plane Crash in South Korea

Is the Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retirement announcement round the corner? - The Indian Express
summary:
Title: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Retirement: When, Not If?

Date & Source: January 10, 2023 - Indian Express

It's no longer a case of if, but when will Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma call it a day? After a disappointing series against Australia, speculation is rife about the retirement of these two cricket legends.

  1. The 50-over Champions Trophy is just 50 days away, and their decision might come before or after that.
  2. There's also the possibility of an announcement during the fifth and final Test in Sydney.
  3. Rohit Sharma's performance in the fourth Test was a mix of promise and disappointment, raising questions about his future in Test cricket.
  4. Virat Kohli's mental discipline and form have been a talking point throughout the series, with the Australian crowd even booing him during the fourth Test.

"There has been a shoulder barge, luckily there was a hundred at Perth, but my takeaway of Kohli isn’t anything from this series; I shall happily takeaway memories from what he has done here in the past. We Australians haven’t seen the best of Rohit in Tests, but as said, he seems past it." - Jim Maxwell, ABC radio commentator

Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been stalwarts of the Indian cricket team for years, and their retirement would mark a significant change in the team's dynamics. The cricket fraternity and fans worldwide await their decision with bated breath.
newTitle: Is Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Retirement Imminent?

title: Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 25: Allu Arjun film flexes big in India; beats combined collections of Baby John, Marco, Max - The Indian Express
summary:
Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 25: Allu Arjun film flexes big in India; beats combined collections of Baby John, Marco, Max

Publication Date: 2024-12-25 | Source: The Indian Express

The blockbuster success of Pushpa 2: The Rule is evident from its impressive box office performance, outperforming several films released during the Christmas period.

  • In its fourth week, Pushpa 2 grossed Rs 37.25 crore in India.
  • It surpassed the combined earnings of Baby John, Marco, and Max which were released recently.
  • The film has become the highest grosser in Indian cinema for 2024.
  • Pushing the gross to Rs 1719.5 crore globally, it is expected to breach the Rs 1800 crore mark soon.
  • The film's dubbed version has also seen unprecedented success in the Hindi market.
“If this doesn’t showcase the strength and pull of this Allu Arjun-starrer, then what will?”

With no major releases imminent, Pushpa 2 is likely to maintain its strong position in theaters for the foreseeable future.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Continues Strong Box Office Performance in India

title: Punjab Bandh LIVE updates: Farmers protest hit traffic, other services in state, blockade at key entry points | Today News - Mint
Punjab bandh farmers protest: Commuter traffic crippled; rail, bus service suspended - The Hindu
summary:
Punjab bandh farmers protest: Commuter traffic crippled; rail, bus service suspended

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Life was significantly disrupted in Punjab due to a statewide bandh called by farmers demanding a legal guarantee for minimum support prices (MSP) for their crops.

  • Rail and road traffic were heavily affected, leading to the suspension of various services.
  • Commercial establishments remained closed throughout the state.
  • Farmers conducted sit-ins on key roads, causing major traffic disruptions.
  • Emergency services were exempted from the bandh restrictions.
  • Farmer leaders claimed the bandh received wide support from different community groups.
“All establishments are closed. Punjabis have shown their unity today and they are extending full support,” claimed farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher.

The protest reflects the ongoing tensions between farmers and the central government regarding agricultural policies.
newTitle: Punjab Bandh: Farmers Protest Disrupts Commuter Traffic and Services
